Package ie.gmit.dip

Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.dip.Input
  • public class Input
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Input()
      Creates a new Input object that is ready for taking and processing an input inserted to the console.

    • Method Summary

      int inputInt()
      Returns integer that has been inserted to the console.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Input

        public Input()
        Creates a new Input object that is ready for taking and processing an input inserted to the console.

    • Method Detail

      • selectOption

        public int selectOption​(int min,
                        int max)
        Returns an integer as an chosen option by the User.

        It displays a range of options and asks User to select one from the range. It accepts only integers. The range of options is specified by the min and max parameters.

        Parameters:
        min - a minimum value for option
        max - a maximum value for option
        Returns:
        a selected option

      • inputString

        public java.lang.String inputString()
        Returns the whole input as a string
        Returns:
        a whole input as a string

      • pressEnter

        public void pressEnter​(java.lang.String message)
        Displays a message for the User and waits and reads the whole line
        Parameters:
        message - an info to be displayed for the User

      • inputWords

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> inputWords()
        Returns set of Strings.

        Takes words as an arguments and parses to the set of Strings. It uses space key as a delimiter.

        Returns:
        sets of words. Size may be 0

      • inputInt

        public int inputInt()
        Returns integer that has been inserted to the console.
        Returns:
        integer that has been inserted
